question.title: Deprecated Gradle command "expand"
question.body:
In my Java Spring Boot project I use Gradle for building automation. Some time ago I added a little code snippet to the build.gradle file that gets the version from this file and inserts it into an appropriate entry within the application.yml file.

processResources {
    filesMatching('application.yml') {
        expand([buildVersion: project.version]) // Match the placeholder in application.yml ($buildVersion).
    }
}

Now, when I run ./gradlew clean build I get a deprecation notice Deprecated Gradle features were used in this build, making it incompatible with Gradle 9.0.. According to gradle-wrapper.properties I am in use of Gradle 8.13 and Java 23. Seems this needs an update of the code segment, specifically the expand part. What exactly though? What must be done to essentially achieve the same thing but with updated code or logic?

question_comments.body: It's just a warning from the Gradle build tooling to tell you that your build scripts (or a first/third-party Gradle plugin) are using features that might potentially be removed in a future release - you can add the --warning-mode=all flag to that command (as indicated in stackoverflow.com/a/51610775) to determine as to what portion of your build logic is using deprecated code
